page.title: 10The Eyton Shoot
page.content: The Eyton Shoot is run on 3000 acres of farm and woodland at Eyton on the Weald Moors.A syndicate own the shooting rights and pay an annual fee to cover the Gamekeepers wages and raising the game (Pheasant and Partridge).In spring eggs are collected from laying hens and hatched in incubators.Chicks are reared in brooders until 7 weeks old,then transfered to release pens in Rookery woods and Sydney plantations.Six weeks later they are released to become wild.The Gamekeeper lives in Sydney Cottages near his work which entails caring for the chicks,controling vermin and guarding against poaching. Shooting occurs on Saturdays and Wednesdays during the season,starting 1st Sept for Partridge,1st Oct for Pheasant,ending Feb 2nd.Locals are employed as beaters.
